answers.answer: nothing's going to happen. you'll have to be put on a special diet if you have it. i failed my test the first time and passed the 3hr one.
Is my baby going to be ok if I fail again tho?
Sorry I just read your post again ok I was just worry something will be wrong with my baby now
I was 180 and my doctor didnt send me back for other test she just told me to avoid sweet food that can make my sugar level high and do home test . So thank god im 80 now.
How do u do a home test

Sometimes babies measure two weeks or more ahead of their gestational age if you have gestational diabetes. I read  your post sometime back regarding measurements And if you don't keep your blood glucose level within the normal range, your baby might have certain issues with the diabetes when they grow or they might even get a certain type of diabetes. I am not scarring you but I am just telling you what I heard since you were interested in knowing. What was the test you did? Was it the 10 hour fasting test? If you are on good diet hopefully things would turn positive on your next test.

Yes my baby measures two weeks ahead And I didn't fast at all with my first Glucose test bc they said I didn't have to And my eating is not the best but not the worst either I try to make healthier choices even if it's not the best for example I don't have cal
Caffeine every day like I use to or eat fast food every day like I use to and instead of sodas I do juice water or lemonade

Nothing will happen to your baby, you may just have to watch your babies weight. Although measuring ahead can be misleading... I didn't have gestational diabetes and I measured 3 weeks ahead for quite a while. You will be on a special diet, sometimes with insulin depending on the severity and you'll just have to be watched over a little more.

I was pre diabetic before I became pregnant. Since then has been upgraded to gestational diabetes. My baby is perfectly healthy I just have to take shots of insulin a couple times a day. Its not that bad and they really don't hurt at all. My doctor says my metabolism should go back to the way it was before, after the baby is born.
Hopefully I past or if not I hope it goes away after my baby and omg it's sounds scary having to take shots of insulin :/ I already have high blood pressure fml

It was a little bit more wracking at first, but once you get the hang of it, it really doesn't hurt at all. Especially if you get the pen injector. The needle is so super tiny you can't feel it at all.

question: I fail my diabetes test with 150 something they said and I have to go to the hospital for the 3 hour one what if I fail again what's going to happen to my baby ??? :,(
